title: The Quaker disarm'd, or, A true relation of a late publick dispute held at Cambridge by three eminent Quakers against one scholar of Cambridge ; with a letter in defence of the ministry and against lay-preachers ; also several qu√¶ries proposed to the Quakers to be answered if they can.
author: Smith, Thomas, 1623 or 4-1661.
notes: The three Quakers are George Whitehead, William Allen and George Fox. They are disputing with Thomas Smith.
Attributed to Thomas Smith. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in Friends' Library, London.
Imperfect: imprint date torn; film also lacks: Questions propounded by George Whitehead and George Fox / Richard Blome.
